meanings.definition: The quality or state of being serial.
meanings.sent1: The serialities of the TV show kept viewers hooked on the storyline.
meanings.sent2: The book's plot was driven by the serialities of events that unfolded one after another.
meanings.sent3: The detective couldn't resist the serialities of the case, like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her life seemed to be a series of interconnected serialities, each chapter leading to the next.
meanings.sent5: The serialities of the clock ticking away marked the passage of time in the room.

meanings.definition: The condition of being arranged in a series.
meanings.sent1: The serialities of numbers on the board made it easy to follow the sequence.
meanings.sent2: The serialities of colors in the rainbow create a beautiful spectrum in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The serialities of ingredients in the recipe ensured a delicious outcome.
meanings.sent4: The serialities of cars parked in rows made the parking lot look organized.
meanings.sent5: The serialities of events in history books help us understand the timeline of the past.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being sequential or in a series.
meanings.sent1: The serialities of steps in the process made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: The serialities of tasks on the to-do list helped prioritize the work.
meanings.sent3: The serialities of jokes in the comedian's routine kept the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: The serialities of waves crashing on the shore created a calming rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The serialities of notes in the melody formed a beautiful song.
